Wilmot began his career at Stevenage in the club's academy before breaking through into the first-team during the [[2017–18 in English football|2017–18]] season. He subsequently signed for Watford in May 2018. Wilmot was loaned out to Serie A club Udinese in January 2019. He has also represented [[England national football team|England]] at [[England national under-19 football team|U19]] and [[England national under-20 football team|U20]] level. ==Club career== ===Stevenage=== Wilmot joined [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] as an academy scholar,{{cite news | title = Ben Wilmot signs professional terms | url = https://www.stevenagefc.com/news/2017/april/ben-wilmot-signs-professional-contract/ | publisher = Stevenage F.C. | date = 2 April 2017 | accessdate = 4 October 2017}} and progressed through the youth ranks at his hometown club. As a first-year scholar, he signed his first professional contract with the club in April 2017, having impressed throughout Stevenage's [[FA Youth Cup]] run during the [[2016–17 FA Youth Cup|2016–17]] season.{{cite news | title = Stevenage duo put pen to paper on new deals | url = http://www.thecomet.net/stevenage-fc/stevenage-duo-put-pen-to-paper-on-new-deals-1-4960991 | publisher = ''The Comet'' | date = 2 April 2017 | accessdate = 4 October 2017}} He made his first-team debut on 3 October 2017, playing the whole match in the centre of defence as Stevenage drew 0–0 away at [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in the [[EFL Trophy]].{{cite news | title = Report: MK Dons 0–0 Stevenage (5–4 pens) | url = https://www.stevenagefc.com/news/2017/october/match-report-for-mk-dons-vs-stevenage-on-03-oct-17/ | publisher = Stevenage F.C. | date = 3 October 2017 | accessdate = 4 October 2017}} He established himself as a first-team regular throughout January 2018, helping the club keep three clean sheets in six matches.{{Soccerbase season|97353|2017|name=Ben Wilmot|accessdate=4 October 2017}} Stevenage chairman [[Phil Wallace]] stated the club had rejected three bids from [[Premier League]] clubs for Wilmot during the 2018 January transfer window,{{cite news | title = Phil Wallace's inside story on the January Transfer Window | url = https://www.stevenagefc.com/news/2018/february/phil-wallace-stevenage-january-transfer-window-analysis/ | publisher = Stevenage F.C. | date = 1 February 2018 | accessdate = 1 February 2018}} which included a £500,000 bid from [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], whilst [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] offered "slightly less".{{cite news | title = The rise and rise of Ben Wilmot: The England teenager bucking the trend | url = https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/football-league/ben-wilmot-interview-england-u19-rise-and-rise-bucking-the-trend-a8265681.html | publisher = ''Independent'' | date = 21 March 2018 | accessdate = 25 March 2018}} Wilmot was not included in any of Stevenage's matches from the start of April 2018 until the remainder of the season with a transfer "close" to being agreed.{{cite news | title = Wilmot withdrawn from squad as club in talks over transfer | url = https://www.stevenagefc.com/news/2018/april/ben-wilmot-withdrawn-squad-stevenage-fc-transfer-negotiations/ | publisher = Stevenage F.C. | date = 6 April 2018 | accessdate = 24 May 2018}}{{cite news | title = Ben Wilmot: Stevenage chairman says defender close to leaving club | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43674510 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 6 April 2018 | accessdate = 24 May 2018}} He made 15 appearances during the campaign. ===Watford=== Wilmot signed for Premier League side Watford on 24 May 2018, for an undisclosed fee and on a five-year deal.{{cite news | title = Official: Watford Sign Wilmot | url = https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/official-watford-sign-wilmot | publisher = Watford F.C. | date = 24 May 2018 | accessdate = 24 May 2018}} Stevenage stated that the fee was a record transfer fee received by the club and that it could rise significantly based on Wilmot's future appearances.{{cite news | title = Ben Wilmot signs with Watford for club record fee | url = https://www.stevenagefc.com/news/2018/may/ben-wilmot-signs-watford-record-fee-premier-league-defender-stevenage/ | publisher = Stevenage F.C. | date = 24 May 2018 | accessdate = 24 May 2018}} Wilmot made his first-team debut for Watford in the club's [[EFL Cup]] tie away at [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 29 August 2018, starting and playing the whole match in a 2–0 win.{{cite news | title = Reading 0–2 Watford | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45266832 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 29 August 2018 | accessdate = 31 August 2018}} ====Loan to Udinese==== Wilmot joined [[Serie A]] club [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] on loan on 31 January 2019 for the remainder of the [[2018–19 in Italian football|2018–19]] season.{{cite news | title = Official: Wilmot leaves on loan | url = https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/official-wilmot-leaves-loan | publisher = Watford F.C. | date = 31 January 2019 | accessdate = 31 January 2019}} ==International career== Wilmot was called up to represent [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]]s in March 2018 for their three [[2018_UEFA_European_Under-19_Championship_qualification#Group_2_2|2018 UEFA European U19 Championship qualification]] matches in [[Skopje]].{{cite news | title = Ben Wilmot named in England U19 squad | url = https://www.stevenagefc.com/news/2018/march/ben-wilmot-england-u19s-international-duty-15th-march-2018/ | publisher = Stevenage F.C. | date = 15 March 2018 | accessdate = 15 March 2018}} Wilmot was the only player outside of the top two divisions to be named in the squad. He made his England U19 debut in a 3–0 win over [[Latvia national under-19 football team|Latvia U19]]s on 24 March 2018, coming on as an 84th-minute substitute in the match.{{cite news | title = England U19 3–0 Latvia U19 | url = https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2018/03/24/europe/uefa-u19-championship/england-under-19/latvia-under-19/2698772/ | publisher = Soccerway | date = 24 March 2018 | accessdate = 25 March 2018}} In doing so, he became the first Stevenage player to represent England at youth level. ==Personal life== He is the son of former [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] goalkeeper Richard Wilmot, who made over 150 appearances for the [[Hertfordshire]] club.{{cite news | title = Boroguide – Ben Wilmot | url = http://www.boroguide.co.uk/players/player.php?ID=906 | publisher = Boroguide | accessdate = 4 October 2017}}{{cite news | title = Boroguide – Richard Wilmot | url = http://www.boroguide.co.uk/players/player.php?ID=251 | publisher = Boroguide | accessdate = 4 October
